intro: Geissois hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy geissois, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom during the rainy season. Geissois hirsuta is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in warm, humid climates.
